com.ecs.utils
Class XMLUtils

java.lang.Object
  com.ecs.utils.XMLUtils
public class XMLUtils
extends java.lang.Object

The class contains a number of XML Dom related utility methods.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Gordon Sandeman

getElementChildText

public static java.lang.String getElementChildText(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
For a given XML Element returns its text node text

Parameters:
element - containing a text node
Returns:
text node text as string

getParentNodeByName

public static org.w3c.dom.Node getParentNodeByName(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                                   java.lang.String parentName)
For a particular node it returns the first parent node whose name matches parentName. If a Node with name parentName cannot be found the function returns null

Parameters:
node - from where the parent node check will start
parentName - the name of the parent node to search for
Returns:
The Node which is an antecedent of node with the name parentName

Takes a filename of an XML file and reads it into an XML Document object

Parameters:
fileName - of an XML document
Returns:
XML document as a Document object

getTextContents

public static java.lang.String getTextContents(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
Returns the contents of all immediate child text nodes. Takes a node as input and merges all its immediate text nodes into a string.

Parameters:
node - node to extract text contents of
Returns:
string containing text contents of the node

findValue

public static java.lang.String findValue(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                         java.lang.String xql)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the text contents of the first node mathcing an XPath expression. Takes a context node and an xpath expression and finds a matching node. The text contents of this node are returned as a string

Parameters:
node - context node at which to eval xpath
xql - XPath expression
Returns:
Text contents of matching node
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

setValue

public static org.w3c.dom.Node setValue(org.w3c.dom.Node startNode,
                                        java.lang.String value,
                                        java.lang.String xql)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Finds a node based on an XPath expression and sets the text contents of it. Takes a context node and an XPath expression. The matching node gets a text node appending containing the contents of the value string. The node matching the XPath expression is returned

Parameters:
startNode - context node on which to evaluate the xpath
value - the text to add to the matched node
xql - the XPath expression
Returns:
Returns the matched node
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getNodeByAttrValue

public static org.w3c.dom.Node getNodeByAttrValue(org.w3c.dom.Node startNode,
                                                  java.lang.String xql)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
Finds and returns a node matching Xpath expression. Takes a context node and an XPath expression. Returns that node. Use is similar to getElementById but searches by an arbituary attribute (defined in the XPath expression string).

Parameters:
startNode - context node on which to evaluate the xpath
xql - the XPath expression
Returns:
First node matching XPath expression
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

appendNode

public static org.w3c.dom.Node appendNode(org.w3c.dom.Node startNode,
                                          java.lang.String name,
                                          java.lang.String xql)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Append a node with the given name at the specified location in the document. Takes a context node, the name of the new node, and an XPath expression. The new node is appended to the document at the point specified by the context node and the XPath statement

Parameters:
startNode - context node on which to evaluate the xpath
name - the name of the new node
xql - the XPath expression
Returns:
Returns the newly appended node
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

toString

public static java.lang.String toString(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Converts an Element Node or Document into its text representation. Converts either the SubTree designated by an Element node or an entire tree, specified by a Document object into an XML Text representation.

Parameters:
node - The DOM node (doc or element) to convert
Returns:
The input string's representation
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
